thread.title: College Football Roundup: Bluffton, ONU both roll
thread.title_full: College Football Roundup: Bluffton, ONU both roll

author: The Courier
title: College Football Roundup: Bluffton, ONU both roll
text:
Comment: 0 
BLUFFTON — Bluffton jumped out to a 37-0 halftime lead and cruised past winless Earlham 51-20 in a Heartland Collegiate Athletic Conference football game on Saturday. Conner Sheehan and Colby Speice combined for 255 passing yards and five touchdowns for Bluffton (3-3, 2-2 HCAC). Micah Roberson caught five passes for 114 yards, including a 66-yard score from Sheehan. Korbin Showalter and Ryan Aelker caught a 29- and 5-yard touchdown pass, respectively, from Sheehan. Zach Zavakos (39 yards) and Colton Kelso (2 yards) had touchdown receptions from Speice. Wesley Hundley threw for 184 yards, rushed for 123 yards and had three total touchdowns for Earlham (0-7, 0-5 HCAC). 
Earlham 0 0 7 13 — 20 Bluffton 16 21 7 7 — 51 First Quarter Blu — Showalter 29 pass from Sheehan (Watkins kick) Blu — Roberson 66 pass from Sheehan (Watkins kick) Blu — Safety Blu — Carroll 24 run (Watkins kick) Blu — Aelker 5 pass from Sheehan (Watkins kick) Blu — Zavakos 39 pass from Speice (Mann kick) Third Quarter Earl — Hundley 31 run (Kerobo kick) Blu — Kelso 2 pass from Speice (Mann kick) Fourth Quarter Earl — Kenner 13 pass from Hundley (kick failed) Blu — Carroll 1 run (Mann kick) Earl — Kenner 8 pass from Hundley (Kerobo kick) 
OHIO NORTHERN 52 CAPITAL 31 ADA — Will Freed threw for 225 yards and two touchdowns and Justin Magazine added 152 yards and two scores on the ground as Ohio Northern pulled away from Capital 52-31 in an Ohio Athletic Conference college football game Saturday. Devon Price hauled in six catches for 151 yards, including a 61-yard score. He also racked up 74 yards on the ground, including a 52-yard run at the end of the third quarter to put Ohio Northern (4-2, 3-2 OAC) ahead 38-31. Freed and Ricardo Johnson also added rushing touchdowns for the Polar Bears. There were five lead changes in the first three quarters. Capital (2-4, 2-3 OAC) ran for 500 yards on 80 attempts. Six players ran for at least 50 yards, led by Nick Iske’s 131 yards. 
Capital 7 14 10 0 — 31 Ohio Northern 7 17 14 14 — 52 First Quarter ONU — Magazine 1 run (DiMario kick) Cap — Brewer 15 run (Johns kick) Second Quarter Cap — Breakey 4 run (Johns kick) ONU — Price 61 pass from Freed (DiMario kick) ONU — Freed 13 run (DiMario kick) Cap — Breakey 3 run (Johns kick) ONU — Chaney 46 FG Cap — Lyle 51 run (Johns kick) ONU — Ray 31 pass from Freed (DiMario kick) Cap — Johns 39 FG ONU — Price 52 run (DiMario kick) Fourth Quarter ONU — Magazine 14 run (DiMario kick) ONU — Johnson 1 run (DiMario kick)
